content.detailedDescription:
I'm still apprehensive to report this, i haven't said anything about to anyone until now; it was about 3am and i was traveling on 26, 31, or 33 from idaho falls to jackson wyoming, i can't remember which now and i was just working there not real familiar to the area, in fact i was kind of lost, i barely made it to work in jackson that morning, and i was in a state of shock and a bit worried when i arrived that someone would come after me... on my way to idaho   i saw lights as i came up the road, from far off it looked like a giant ferris wheel on its side, leaning, i thought to myself that was so odd, in the middle of nowhere, in the woods; this? but as i got closer i realized it was surrounded by vehicles, big military vehicles, white vehicles, men in haz-mat looking suits, men with guns..
it was down in a sort of small valley and the road i was on as i reached it began climb up around a mountain (headed toward jackson) so i had a birds eye view by this time. i slowed down, almost to a stop as i seen the ferris wheel i had seen in the distance was in fact not a ferris wheel, it was a huge space ship! it was crashed i almost wrecked staring at it i couldn't hear or see anything i was just in shock.
it had to have been at least 80-100 feet across, it was shaped more or less just like you see on tv, a disk shaped thing with a portal/door at the base, it had windows all around the middle of the ship, and toward the base it had colored lights, i know there was red, blue and orange or yellow..
by this time i started coming back to my senses and realized i was in danger; men began running to their vehicles and waving their arms and yelling, drawing their firearms, heading up the mountainside toward me, needless to say i took off pedal to the medal no exaggeration, it would take them a minute or so to get back on the road as where they were there was only a crude rough road winding down to where the spacecraft was, so i immediately had an advantage, i barreled up the road reaching 90 + miles per hour in my jeep grand cherokee 4x4 on a winding, incline with cliff on one side and a wall of mountain on the other, suddenly animals were running across the road and up the mountain away from the site, i kid not; there were raccoons, deer, and all sorts of creatures just migrating away from there! i was slowing then speeding weaving in and out of these creatures, i hit the mountainside more than once and careened almost off the cliff several times, i'm telling you it was the most blood pumping thing that ever happened to me and i have been in some situations..
all kinds of things raced through my mind as i sped away from there looking in rear view mirror.
thankfully i got away, i started taking random small roads as soon as i seen them to lose a trail, and eventually  through meandering all the rest of the morning i arrived in jackson just before 8 as my shift started. i thought about what happened and my friends all told me i looked like something was wrong, i said i was just not feeling well, but what was bothering me was what exactly was going on back there?? would it be in the news? of course not.. were those men after me? and also a feeling of wonder, and excitement that i had witnessed something i called others crazy for believing in.. it was really true; there is something out there..
content.summary: What i saw in the summer of 2001

content.detailedDescription: Driving along near fm 1119 in tanyard near the madison/leon county line, i spotted 3 bright, white, star like objects on the se horizon. they appeared to be equidistant from one another and were positioned in the manner of orion's belt (though it was not orion's belt because i spotted the constellation higher up in the sky just minutes before), and were arranged in a staggered, akimbo like, but parallel position. i kept my eye on them and the two outermost objects appeared to move slightly upwards. i lost sight of the objects for a few seconds due to trees. when i regained sight of them, the leftmost object was gone. then, i lost view of the objects once again due to trees and did not see them again when i came to a clear spot. they weren't stars, and i don't know if they were otherworldly objects or someone having fun with flares. all i know is they were unidentified and were flying.
content.summary: 3 star like objects spotted in se sky

content.detailedDescription: Driving down i-95 southbound my girlfriend spotted a group of cars on the side of the road and saw them looking and pointing towards the western sky. she promptly looked in the direction they were pointing and saw a disc shaped craft glowing orange hovering in the southwestern sky. she then called me at home and took two photographs of the object with her 6.2 mega pixel kodak c613 digital camera. one came out blurry but the other was much clearer and you can make out the shape of a craft moving away from her. not sure what it was but obviously it had attracted enough attention to get people to stop on the side of a busy highway to view it. while watching it she said she saw a smaller probe like object, glowing as well, come out and away from the main craft. i have attatched photographs, the original and one i blew up in a photo editing software.
content.summary: Orange glowing disc shaped craft hovering then moving away

content.detailedDescription: These two pictures were taken at the mayan ruins of tulum, both ufo's pictured were not visible to the camera at the time. my father and i were accompanied by an entire tour group and snapping photos of the ruins and surrounding areas, in all we caught five unidentified flying objects above the ruins between both of our cameras that day. these are unedited, raw photos. the tour was not the only one that day, yet no one seemed to notice any of the shapes in the sky. it was only now, a week later, after going through the photos that we see these objects. in the first, the object is easily identified,just to the right of the face, and in the second, it is just off to the left of the building.
content.summary: Ufo's over mayan ruins of tulum.

content.detailedDescription:
When coming home from my parents home that night, me and my girlfriend noticed a star in the se sky while heading south on highway 82. it appeared to be white to amber in color in the center, with the edges changing or shifting from blue, green, red to orange. many stars seem to change color in just a short spectrums that seem related, but this shifted all colors.
 we pulled down doublegate dr. and pulled into our driveway. we used google starmaps to check the entity. the object was near procyon. upon multiple checkings and viewings the object appeared to be moving. left to right, forward and backwards. and then it started doing very tight, circles. there is a small airport nearby but no plane could turn the radius in a quick manner. there where several planes that passed in the objects direction in the sky, and all were much larger and distinctive wing lights. 
 the weather was cold, clear and breezy. the view was clear with no obstructions. the objects direction was se of us, putting it out in the direction of the airport and marine base.
 after seeing the object and realizing that this is the second time ive seen objects in the night sky i was a bit electrified with my nerves flashing down my back.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Ufo hovering over city in se sky.

content.detailedDescription: I had just got of work around 8:00, when we got home we saw a blue oval light floting through the sky. going north east it was not very high the ufo made no sound, mom said its just a plain no way it was a fling sauser.That was the second ufo i seen. but that time there was another wittnes.Theres not much moore to tell but thats the truth.
content.summary: Blue oval light

content.detailedDescription: When i first noticed the lights i thought maybe it was helicopters because they appeard to be close to each other.  the lights were steady not flashing or blinking.  approx 6 or 7 redish orange lights appeared sationary at first then three moved to form a triangle then spread apart.  we were driving so had to take a side street to see again.  three lights disappeared leavin approx 3 or 4 for about 30 seconds then all lights disappeared.  the lights never blinked or flashed and made no streaks we could see when they moved. a few were more intense in color than the others.  we are in a rural area and there are no cell towers or any types of lights in this area.
content.summary: Approx 6 redish orange lights appeared stationary at first

content.detailedDescription: I got a nikon 3100 camera and af-s dx zoom-nikkor 55-200mm lens (which has a 1.5x magnification zoom of the naked eye) for christmas. i am currently staying at my grandmother's condo in bradenton,which is on the 5th floor of the building and faces mostly east and slightly to the north. i was playing with my camera, zooming in on an airplane through the viewfinder, flying far in the right/south of where i was standing, when a fast moving orange sphere entered the frame. it was far in front of the plane (closer to me than the plane) and traveled quickly from south to north. my camera battery was charging so after taking the camera away from my face to view it with my eyes in disbelief, i ran to get my battery and was able to snap 3 pictures before it disappeared into the hazy sky above. all i could see was a glowing orange sphere- it did not have any other lights, it did not have blinking lights. at first it looked like a fire ball. - unfortunately, i captured the sphere without a reference point to show its relation to the ground/buildings because i zoomed in as much as possible. the interesting part is the power of the zoom and size of the picture allows me to later upload and zoom in very close to the object. if i took a picture of airplane lights, i would be able to zoom in and make out the entire plane. with this, there was only a ball of orange light.
content.summary: Bright orange sphere shaped light- captured 3 photos

content.detailedDescription: Me and my cousin were riding our skateboards along the sidwalk parallel to middle beach rd. we were heading directly towards the beach and the sun had not yet set. suddenly, a very bright light appeared in the blue sky approximately 30 degrees above the sun and approximately 45 degrees above the horizon. i turned to my cousin to ask him if he was seeing the same thing that i was and he said that he was. as i turned back to look at the object it reduced in brightness and became just a small whitish line which then disappeared. this all transpired in a matter of seconds and the object/light was stationary for the duration of the sighting. we were both in shock and stopped skateboarding to reflect on our thoughts of what we had just witnessed. as i was saying out loud that we had just seen a ufo, i was looking at the sidewalk and my cousin shouted that he saw it again but this time it was more like a pinpoint of light with a ring or halo like light around it, when i tried to look again it had already vanished. i can best describe it as if someone had turned a flashlight on and off in the middle of the sky. it was as if the object was metallic/mirrorlike and had reflected the sun's light directly into my eyes. i felt that it had come from another dimension into ours for seconds, then returned.
content.summary: Star like flash of bright light

content.detailedDescription: I was coming up the road in my skidsteer on my way to do some plowing at our job site off of school house rd by hayward and the light appeared seemingly out of nowhere. i grabbed my phone and got the picture(i alomost missed it) seconds later it zipped off to the west! i took another picture of the same spot to show that it wasn't "the sun" or something else.  pic one is the light and pic two is right afterwards.
content.summary: Appeared and flew off

content.detailedDescription: I was outside at my job and saw a strange glow in the sky. i was just off of route 378 in bethlehem, pa. i thought it was a xmas decoration hovering over someones home to the west of where i was standing.  i realized it was not that when it came floating towards me followed by two others.  it was orange and redish and in a circular form though it was not a solid circle.  they seemed low and close i would say at arms length i would have used a half dollar to cover them from visibility.  i then looked to the west and saw another coming towards me but closer.  i called into my coworkers who came outside and also observed this.  the four objects were not flying or floating.  the movement was very calm and peaceful, i cannot describe it.  the four objects then seemed to hover for a bout 2-3 minutes and then proceede toward the east and hung there in a distance for 7-8 minutes and then just faded away.
content.summary: 4 plasma orbs

content.detailedDescription: I was visiting a friend in dracut ma. and we were looking out the window at the night sky.  we noticed an extremely bright white light that was far too large to be a star and appeared to be in a triangle or diamond shape with rays of light projecting out all around it.  it had not been there only an hour or two before when we were looking at the sky and once it appeared it stayed there for hours.  it never moved, the brightness and color (white) never changed and there was absolutely nothing around it, the sky was very clear and you could easily see that it was not suspended from nor supported by another object.  it was very disconcerting, neither my friend nor i had ever seen anything like this before and we couldnt take our eyes off it.  we went outside and looked at it from there and it remained exactly the same as it appeared from the inside.  we  went back inside and continued to watch it as we talked over several hours time.  it was still there when we went to bed, which i was actually afraid to do because the light bothered me so much.  the following night it appeared to be gone.  i have searched the web in hopes of finding someone else who saw it and have found nothing and yet it was so stunning and unusual that i cant believe we were the only ones to notice it!  i would like very much to know if you have any information about this particular sighting which was at about 2 or 3 am on december 24th 2010 over dracut ma.Or  possibly lowell ma area.  it was hard to tell exactly what area it was over but this is the closest guess i can come to.  thank you
content.summary: Very bright white light seen in the sky over lowell ma area 12/24/10 about 2am

content.detailedDescription:
Location: backyard patio;  *(wit's residence coordinates moved to additional evidence section--cms/sg).

stepped out of back door to retrieve firewood from wood bin.  glanced into eastern sky and saw bright orange sphere approaching.  initial thought was a meteor or missile shot from wallops island.  quickly realized object had no tail as it continued to move sw towards house.  initial estimate was object was between 5000-6000' high, traveling about 200-250mph.  knowing it was unusual i turned and opened door and told my wife to come look at the object.  object had continued sw but then appeared to maneuver lower in sky with a series of turns to the south and the back to the west.  due to moisture in air object appeared to have a "halo" around it with a slight cone of light towards leading edge.  

my wife joked "it must be santa claus".   there were no aviation navigation lights, landing lights, anti-collision lights observed and object maintained bright orange color. at this point, maybe 45 seconds into sightings i determined that this may be a ufo.  as object reached a spot about 70-80 degrees in elevation while looking se from my back patio, it accelerated and climbed at an extremely fast speed heading sw until it disappeared from sight approximately 30 degrees above horizon. object was not in any standard traffic patterns for nas norfolk, norfolk international, or washington center from my experience.  could not determine if loss of sight on object was due to cloud cover or due to height.  entire episode lasted no more than two minutes and there was no propeller or rotor noise, engine noise, etc., associated with object.  i contacted 911 who had no information about any reported sightings or unusual activity and offered to transfer me to the nas duty officer.  i declined the phone transfer.

my wife's comments during event indicated she thought it looked like a star due to the "rays" that appeared to emanate from object.  i thought this may be due to moisture, clouds, atmospherics, etc.  she also said "how come it isn't making any noise?"

15 minutes later i heard propeller aircraft turning and launching from nas norfolk, a distance of 3.02 miles north of my home.   i saw and heard both civilian and military aircraft in the traffic patterns at navy norfolk and norfolk international airport (4.25 miles east of residence) with standard navigation lights, anti-collision lights and landing lights.   the object observed was closer both horizontally and vertically at closest point of approach than any of the military/civilian aircraft yet did not generate any sound.

aviation metar for time of incident from naval air station norfolk:

kngu 04008kt 75m ovc041 02/mo2 a3000 rmk ao2 slp159 t00171017

local readings at my residence: barometric pressure 30.00, humidity 78%,  winds ne 5-9mph
overcast with very light rain/snow, estimated visibility 7-8 miles


personal background:
mufon member, retired naval flight officer (1994 with 20 years carrier aviation service), bs in mechanical/nuclear engineering, ms engineering management, currently systems engineer with 16 years engineering, communications, aviation, intelligence experience.
content.summary: Bright orange object appeared on eastern horizon, going w/sw, maneuvered, lost altitude, maneuvered, and then accelerated sw gaining altitude before going out of sight

content.detailedDescription:
Ufos in hudson dec 25 2010

sunday, december 26, 2010

1:45 am

hi,

i would like to report a ufo sighting.



this took place in hudson quebec, canada, dec 25, 2010, christmas evening, at approx. 9:15 pm.



my wife and i, and my two children aged 26 and 22, were visiting my nephew there and we were at a gathering of family to celebrate christmas... dinner.

my daughter had a few pieces of fireworks left over from the summer and we decided to walk over, a block, to a clearing beside a nearby school. 

there was about a foot of hard snow on the ground and the temperature late that afternoon was between 10 and 15 degrees celsius below zero.  there was no wind.

there were 12 of us in all, including three young children.  all the others were adults of ages 22 through 60.

my nephew and a friend of his were present.  both are experienced commercial pilots.

i myself am a retired mechanical engineer, aged 60.  there were several other professionals among us.

i set up a few firework sticks in the ground and proceeded to fire them off.  there were a total of about 8 items, five of which shot simple 'light balls' high up.  

the sky was slightly hazy in areas, and stars could be seen easily through most of this haziness.

i was in charge of the fireworks; the others were about 100 feet away for safety.  there was one fairly bright street light just off to one side and behind us.

at the end of the final launch, the whole of which took about 10 minutes, one of our girls called out something to the likes of... ��� oh, what are those���.  we all looked up to the back-side sky, partly obscured by the streetlight.  it helped to block the streetlight with, say, one���s hand, in order to see the objects better, at least from my own point of view.

there, we all witnessed what i can only describe as glowing colors, changing from copper-red, to golden hues, orbs.

their size was roughly 10 times the diameter of jupiter (as it has been lately), though not as bright.  they were not spectacularly bright, nor were they dull; (like amber highway lights about 15 poles distant).  if there had been any clear shape patterns/or distortions they would have been noticed.  the shapes did not change much, basically oval/spherical.

we estimated (the pilots jumped in to help) the distances to be roughly 1 to 2 kilometers away at elevations of about 2000-3000 feet or so, angled about 40 degrees with the horizon.

a couple of us had seen what was most likely a plane passing far overhead and above them, at perhaps 10,000 feet.

however, we focused on the  two orbs.  they were very clearly visible and well below any cloud mist.

i quickly asked if anyone had brought with them a camera.  no one answered to the affirmative, even though we had many cameras back at the house, a block away.  nonetheless, my niece had indeed brought her old cell-phone camera and had tried to snap a picture; she and her companion reported that the picture did not register, either believing that there was not enough light or that she was not able to get the objects into focus within the short time they presented themselves to us.

the orbs were present for only about 3 minutes, from the time we first discovered them... they may have been there longer, but not observed.

the orbs were moving in a roughly north-easterly direction, and slowly.  they made no sound that anyone could hear.

we were looking at them and they were traveling in our direction, at first.  

it was shortly after the fireworks show that we first noticed them.  within the subsequent 1st minute, the orb at the left appeared to come to a stop, and did not change its brightness, except for the color changes (about one full cycle per 3 seconds).  the second varied at what appeared to be the same rate.  the variation transitioned smoothly/continuously, not in an abrupt off-on manner. 

the orb on the right was at first about the width of 2-3 fingers apart (held at arms length) from the orb on the left.  it appeared to brighten until it roughly matched that of the left orb.  it then started to move forward as the other remained put, after first hesitating.  it made a bending pattern movement and came around much closer to the left orb.  i thought at one instant that it was going to connect up with the other, but it came instead to within a distance of about one finger width away (at arms length).

at that point it stayed put and the left orb slowly moved in a new direction to the south-east.  shortly afterword, the second orb slowly started to move in the same direction, following.  both went on their way into the distance and faded out of sight within the 3rd-4th minutes.

it really appeared to all of us that these objects had been observing us and only changed direction after having noticed that our show was over, or that they had been discovered.

in discussing with the pilots, they decided to call in to their professional connections to see if any planes were in the area at this level, that might explain the observations.  two calls were made, with no confirmations of any such low flights.

we conjectured:  

none of the lights were typical of any known plane standards, that the pilots could think of.  there were no sounds at all, if one were to consider helicopters in the area, as a cause.  this amazing coincidence of two objects seemingly communicating with each other, on christmas evening, at this hour, was very unusual.  in particular, the coincidence of our lighting fireworks (or anyone doing so on this day), and the timing of the orbs seems inexplicable.  their change in direction within a minute of our observing them is equally uncanny; they seemed to be watching us.

the transitioning lights were not beams of light shining down onto the earth nor into the sky��� no traces in the slightly misty air.  the 'entire' objects were clearly illuminated as opposed to lights on the objects��� this is unusual.

and finally the most unusual coincidence of all.  i had been, early in the same day, looking back at digital pictures i'd taken two years ago in northern newfoundland, of what i was curiously suspecting might be a ufo.  i'd taken 3 high resolution pictures of this but had never gone back to study them.  i showed these to my daughters this same day, and we guessed, in the end, that the object in this case, was more likely an unusual weather balloon ������dirigible that had a shape ���resembling a dragon���.  next, just before i showed up to light the fireworks, (the others arrived at the clearing 5 minutes before me), my daughter was explaining to one of the pilots there about the story of those other pictures.  they were joking about it all��� and then, this new  experience occurred. also, one of the fireworks pieces was called 'alien invasion' and my wife was calling out to bring on the aliens, in gesture only. very weird indeed.

all this was a very real experience that can be confirmed by all present.  the three children were unfortunately quite upset and frightened by the sighting.  it took us a few hours to calm them afterwards and convince them of an alternate acceptable explanation for all this.



sincerely 

*(wit's name and identifying information deleted -- cms/sg).
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Two red orbs sighted by 12 people

content.detailedDescription: On the aforementioned time and date, my daugther and myself where traveling home after an evening with friends. we traveled east bound from our friends house to our home, approximately 7 miles away on a north east direction. it had been raining and the west side of town was very flood. visibility was about a half of a mile, because of the rain and dark. i do not drink spirits. "what could that be?" was my first statement, to my daugther. her response was"it's a helicopter." as we watched the 3 firey spheres/super white lights, very close together, connected to one object. it didn't spin out of control. but slowly gained speed towards the ground. i realized it had to be farther away than i had first thought. there was no sound. as it approached the ground it started to, come appart or blow up/spark off, but it looked like fire works. the end result of fireworks before they  go out. the object just went straight into the ground. i turned my radio to news, and realized it was far away from us as we where driving in the direction of it as fast as i safely could. no sirens, no sound, and i could see from about,( since i don't know where it went down)away 8 to 20 miles in a rain storm, at night. nothing in the paper. the object must have been huge. this wouldn't be the first time. my daugther and i have seen numerous things unexplained out here near edwards afb.
content.shape: Fireball,   Flash,   Sphere,   Star-like,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: Saw a 3 sphere something blow up and go into/crash?, into the ground, near edwards afb,ca.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my girlfriends brother were outside by the garage and he was smoking and i was looking at the sky beause just a few hours ago it was raining really hard and i spotted a chevron shaped formation making no noise no lights just hovbering at faster then avrage speed but not too fast just faster then waht birds would fly. i ran in and got my girlfreind and see saw it too they were round and looked white flying fast.
content.summary: Chevron type formation with no lights or sound

content.detailedDescription: It was a nice clear night, just a hair after 8pm. i was outside sitting partially in and out of my vehicle checking in to the local amateur radio net enjoying the weather. waiting for a return on the call list, i was smoking a cigarette and looking around. i looked to the sky to notice an abundance of stars. i saw a few planes flying at 10,000 feet or so and noticed a light approaching from the north/northwest as it was kind of dull. i make my comments on the net and glance over and still see the lights approaching and heading to a south/southeast direction, i see a dull red light on it close to center but it is not blinking as they do on airplanes and jets. another thing i noticed is that there was no sound from the aircraft, not even from the friction of moving through the air. i live about a mile east of dyess air base and this aircraft had to have flown over the north side of it easy. i absolutely heard no aircraft from dyess, taking off or landing. the only thing i could hear were cars passing by on texas ave. getting more curious i pulled out my spotting scope and stood outside my vehicle to get a better look. the beacon was not pulsing at all and the 3 lights were in the shape of a triangle, wider than it was long. the aircraft had no tail section, and i saw that there was no landing gear. at the central portion of the bottom of the aircraft seemed to be a dull bronze or brown color.  the 3 lights pointed more downward than forward. at this time the vehicle is more south/east than east. i would have to say that by the time i lost sight of it, it had to be maybe 500 to 1000 +/- feet off the ground and the speed was maybe 100mph +/-. all this took place within about 10-15 minutes. i'm standing there thinking, what the hell did i just see and why didn't i remember that my camera was just a few feet away hanging on my gearshift. maybe 10 minutes after i lost sight of it, i heard the 1 or 2 jets starting up at dyess but did not notice if any had taken off. i did not report it to the news, police or on the radio, wanting to avoid ridicule and waiting to see if someone else would, but know one did. i have questioned myself for 2 weeks did i see what i saw, did i miss something, did i forget something or was it even a ufo. mainly frustrated because i did not get a picture of it. i guess i was awestruck. i am a military vet, and a former police officer. when i was in law enforcement, i worked security at several air shows in corpus christi and even worked at nas kingsville so i know what military and civilian aircraft look like and sound like and this was not military or civilian and definetly not the stealth fighter or bomber, i don't know what it was, i just wish i could see it again...
content.summary: I believe i may have seen a ufo flying over south abilene

content.detailedDescription: My relative was heading home (driving) that evening about 9 p.M. from roseville, ca heading south and noticed white lights rotating in the sky over roseville that lasted for 10 minutes or so.  couldn't make out any shape of craft.  there were probably 3 or 4 different lights. they just disappeared suddenly.  my relative knew it was not a plane based on the odd movements of the lights.
content.summary: Rotating lights in the sky over roseville, ca

content.detailedDescription:
About 5:30 pm i looked out my window and saw orange lights flying below the clouds moving north to south. they caught my eye as i was watching tv. i first thought they were the reflection of our christmas lights in the window. when i got up i could tell that they were flying along and my first thought was that they were helicopters flying in formation.

i walked outside to get a better look and was struck by the fact that there was no noise for how low they seemed to be flying. also the lights were not blinking as aircraft lights do. as i watched the lights at the head of the formation seemed to disappear as they flew south. we had low cloud cover tonight so the objects had to be flying low for me to see them. i ran back into the house to grab a camera to shoot some video but all i could find was my cell phone. i did shoot a short video of the lights but the camera on my phone didn't capture much. 

there were about 7 lights in the group flying in a loose formation and i could see two or three of them maneuvering around each other. the main group moved south of my location and disappeared. there was one straggler that was red in color that moved along behind the main group. it eventually moved past and disappeared as well.

i couldn't tell if i lost sight of the objects because they rose through the cloud cover of if their lights were directional and they were shining away from me after they moved by.

my parents were driving north of town and they saw the lights as well. they called me to see if i could see them from town and confirmed that there was no sound from the objects and that they were flying beneath the low clouds.

i came inside and googled recent ufo sightings and came across the footage of the lights seen yesterday in north carolina. the video they captured shows exactly the same lights we saw down to the color and flying style of the objects
content.summary: Line of orange/red spheres moving slowly and silently across the sky

content.detailedDescription:
Stepped outside to make a phone call and i saw a bright star moving northward.  it was as bright as the north star. it was just west of mt. evans (high in the sky) moving north.  it made no sounds.  was moving very fast.  when it was over my locations it started to veer to the east in the direction of denver.
it dimmed down and changed to a reddish color.  when it looked as though it was over lookout mountain it disappeared, just as it would be going over the denver metro area.
it's orbit looked lower than any satellite i've seen in the sky.  the fact that it was absolutely quite, i knew it was not an airplane.  

within minutes of that object disappearing i spotted a reddish colored star like object moving southwest over the rocky mountain divide.  i watched it until it vanished over the horizon.  i spotted it when it was slightly to the north-west of where i was standing.  it was moving more west than it was south.  i am probably about 3 miles north of i-70 just to give you a bearing.  i am in the flight paths of a lot of airplanes and i can say that these 2 objects were not airplanes!

i have seen satellites in the sky before and these were not satellites either.  one thing that struck me is how much lower the first object was, i am guessing it was anywhere  between 35,000-60,000 miles up.  it was about 2.5 times larger than what jupiter appears in the sky.  the red object was higher in the sky than the first one.
content.summary: Bright clear/white light moving fast

content.detailedDescription:
I took pictures of the same double rainbow as did many people. i hope they report too.
mine is not a report of a sighting but rather information to help pin point the sighting. i took 6 pictures with a first generation iphone. 1,2 &3 were taken at the se corner of lankershim and riverside, from 4:03 to 4:04 pm, looking n. 
there are no orbs.

#4 is at 4:15 going east on lankershim. not far fromthe above location.
there are no orbs.

#5 & 6 are heading s on us101 approaching the universal studios blvd overpass at 4:18 pm.
again no orbs.

i hope this is helpful.
content.summary: Re; mufon report #27074

content.detailedDescription:
The top it asked if it was :  an, fb, etc.    it was a combo of both an1 and fb1

              it was july 3rd and our town decided to celebrate july 4th a day early this year. so later on obviously, the fireworks started to go off. at this time i was inside my house and i heard them going off, so i decided to see if i could see them from out my front yard. surprisly so, i saw over 20 neighbors in my front yard.. for a quick moment i thought, "man i should've  charged a fee," laughing to myself.  so i went to mingle with my neighbors.... were watching the show, and i nudged my one neighbor and said, " wouldn't it be cool to see what tonight would look like from an astronaut's point of view?" he said, "yeah it would be kinda cool." right after i said that i immediately looked straight up, and wouldn't you know, i saw this light making a wavy circle, kinda what a current of electricity would look like, but it was connected. i quickly said to everybody, "look straight up!!!, quick!!" apparently a few did because i was heard a few awes..., seconds later, the circle stopped and i noticed it was two lights making this circle... one stopped immediately and the other went in one motion northeast, by this time a woman said, " is that a satellite?!", giggling to myself i said, " no, satellites don't go that fast honey.....,"  i looked to see if the other one was still there, but sadly it disappeared, i had no idea which way it went, for the simple fact my eyes were tracking the other fast moving light.  it took about 8 sec. or so for the first light to get out of our line of sight... and...By this point the fireworks were secondary entertainment... 
i said we just saw two ufos guys.!! ; and of course, people just started not to believe what they just saw...  they were saying ,no, it was something else,  i said ok what was it then.....?  not one person could give me a straight answer... except one child, he said, "that was the coolest thing he has ever seen!!!"  right after that his mother took his hand and proceeded to go home...     
please if anyone reported something similar around that time....  please have them email me ...  please..   it would be helpful to me...
on another note, do you think it was a coincidence, that i was currently researching billy meier's information for the first time, exactly around the time i saw that amazing display of.,,,, w.S.F.M....... (weird. science.Friggin .Magic)   since this event happened i've been doing a lot more research.....
makes you think. :)     if someone could get it contact with me.About this, it would be greatly appreciated...
thanks for your time..  p.S. sorry it took this long to report this...    i just saw the mufon site, and the report option was there, so, i figured i should tell my story....
keeping my eyes to the skys now...    : v )

thanks again for existing mufon..

  william colvard
content.summary: 2 lights circled around each other so fast they made one eliptical circle, then one stopped and the other flew out of sight in under 10

content.detailedDescription:
I was opening the back door for my dad so he could put some meat out side when he said can u see that bright light then i just said we have found a ufo.
it was a circle bright orange with a kind of headlight or scanner moving infront of it moving just in front of it. i was feeling amazed whan i sor it because it was my first ufo.
well i went inside to get my mum, grandad and florie and they said no it's ok so i went back to see it and my sister came along but when i first sor it it going this way / up that way but when i went to it the 2nd time it was moving this way -.
but also when i first sor it was going past 2 bright stars when i sor it the second time the two bright stars had gone just vanished.
content.summary: Bright orange circle with a kind of headlight or scanner

content.detailedDescription:
After dinner i stepped out into backyard, as usual. airport is close to our home, so i always watch the take offs and landing planes in the night sky. all airplanes have blinking lights, either during take off, or landing. this evening, however, a bright star got my attention because it had no blinking lights, did not have the shape of an airplane but moved across the sky, coming from direction of orlando airport, moving at steady but medium-slow pace, heading ne (toward ucf.)

i watched this thing carefully, hoping to see some blinking lights or hear any noise after all, but neither happened. it was funny to see a bright big star move across the sky silently, at christmas time. -thought i report it.
content.summary: Starlike ufo near airport

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on my porch when i noticed 3 egg shaped to roundish extremely orangey and very slow moving. they were so bright and they looked to be in formation and making and upward incline. they scared me because i thought they were extremelt close.. the first object appeared and with second two others were right behind..I ran and got my digital camera which was right by me as i was just looking at our christmas eve shots with our granddaughter and family..I quick lined up a shot now from my outside porch..And also noticed that one object had disappeared..But the other two kept going and then they disappaeared as they went through the trees over our friends homes.. there are no leaves on  the tree of course..So there they were and boom ...Gone..My fiancee finally was out of the house next to me but was a few seconds late..I did get a clear picture and we looked at it. my fiancee and i were able to print the shot in closer and he was more puzzled than me. and, yes, everyone i told said i probably saw santa..Ha..Ha..But it was an amzing sight whatever these objects were. it only lasted 2-3 minutes but i was just curious if anyone else had seen them in nj..Or even my town..Sincerely and very curious.Thanks for hearing me out
content.summary: Saw 3 very bright orangey objects seemto be following eachother rather slowly from west sky to east  in perfect unisom and extremely close

content.detailedDescription: Just to see the skys above my section of the world, i typed my address coordinates, and found lots of pics like theses. i don't have any idea what the h*** these are. any ideas? thanks.
content.summary: Over my house co ordinates from sky watch.Org

content.detailedDescription: I saw a ufo in tallahassee, florida while driving down meridian road. my friend was driving north down meridian rd. and i was sitting in the passengers seat. we were on our way to the tallahassee mall to see a movie. which me did not see. me and my friend were... sceptical believers till we saw this. while looking out the window to my right i saw a triangle in the sky. at first, i assumed it was a cell tower or something then, after thinking for a second, realized that there are no cell towers anywhere near the area. i should know. i've lived in the area for near 25 years now. not to mention, it was very visible. it seemed to be hovering above what would be the southern end of thomasville rd, near the miracle 5 theater. we almost stopped (slowed to a crawl) after i pointed it out to my friend and watched it for near a minute. it made no noise and did not move. it simply hovered. there were bright, blueish lights at each of the three corners. i could clearly see the outline of the triangle and even some detail. and there was very little detail to be seen. that is to say, it was very smooth and seemed to have a mirror finish. and after nearly a minute of watching, it made a full 180 degree turn, in place, and literally streaked out of view. meaning it moved fast enough to leave streaks of blue light behind it nearly a mile long. this is what i saw, described to the best of my ability. i would like to know what i saw, and if anybody else saw the same thing, which i know is a long shot, as there is almost no chance anybody from tallahassee will read this, let alone somebody who saw the same... craft i did. as far as feelings after seeing the craft, i had very few. the overwhelming feeling was of certainty. certainty that i had seen something i had never seen before and something that, as far as i know, humans are not capable of doing. and i must admit, i felt excitement at having an experience of my own. i knew they must be out there. the only question i had was whether or not they were visiting our planet. i no longer ask that question. at least one did, in fact, visit us. and i can only be sure of that because i saw it. i was not high. i was not tripping. i was not hallucinating. i am very sane. and that's all i can say. now, i just need to know. there is very little i wouldn't do to know.
content.summary: Clearly seen tirangle-shaped craft with blueish lights at each corner; mirror finish

content.detailedDescription: I am posting yet another event that just now happened. i just finished up posting a report on this site, and happened to look outside again, and all i can say is omg!  at least 100 spheres of yellow/orange or reddish/orange were moving across the sky in a line.  some of them were forming triangle shapes, but they looked like they were all following each other across the sky.  i took almost 15 minutes of video of this event standing outside on the patio of my house!  this is the most amazing thing i have ever seen! i cannot explain what this was.  they were not planes, and there were no other aircraft in the area that might have been dropping flares.  these things were completely silent, and they just kept coming.  you will see from the video that i took,(this time with my digital camera)them coming from the tree line on the right, and slowly moving across the sky to the left, before just fading out.  i have shown a plane flying in the sky to compare against and also the moon for reference to rule them out as being planes or celestial objects.  these things were moving across the sky in a line, and kept coming for probably a total of 20 minutes...  i don't know what to say.  i literally am speechless as to what i saw...  i'll just let the video do the rest of the talking...
content.summary: Line of orange/yellow spheres and triangle formations going across the sky...

content.detailedDescription: I walked outside facing west to get something out of my car and saw two "fireballs" at almost eye level moving west to east overhead very slowly with no audible sound. i ran inside to tell my dad and came outside to find them directly overhead. i could not tell if it was a ball or disk. from underneath it was definitely lit up by an orange almost flickering light. it almost seemed like it was a round kitelike object being lit underneath by a fire. they continued to float eastward and veered towards eachother and separated. as they floated out of site i noticed a third light sitting further south that didn't seem to be moving but had the same flickering appearance. it slowly floated away. my cell doesn't have video but i got one awful picture. these things completely confused me and i still don't know what i saw but it wasnt a jet or a helicopter. still have a rush
content.summary: 2 fireballs moving west to east overhead

content.detailedDescription: I was watching tv in my living room tonight around 7:30pm which is christmas eve.  the house has big windows and high ceilings, so when you are sitting down on the couch and looking up at the tv which hangs on the wall, you can also see out into the sky.  the sky above my house has airplanes that pass over all the time.  you automatically know that they are planes because they typically have lights that are white in color, and they emit the normal flashing lights pattern as they fly across the sky.  it is a normal and regular occurance to see them through the windows when i am in there watching tv, but this particular event caught my eye.  as i was watching tv tonight, i glanced up at one of the windows because something different caught my eye...  i saw 3 very bright orange lights in a triangle formation slowly moving across the sky almost floating above and toward the house.  i ran and picked up my cell phone, the only camera i had, and went outside and shot about 1 min of footage of the event.  i am an avid ufo hunters follower, and have seen this exact type of formation featured in one of their episodes.  it looked almost exactly like the "phoenix lights" but maybe not as big, and there were only 3 lights that looked like they were in a triangle shape, not the multiple ones you saw in the phoenix footage.  there were however two more lights that were in front and behind the triangle shape.. i will discuss this more below...  i could not believe i was actually seeing this with my own eyes.  i could not even tell that the camera phone even was picking up the lights in the sky.  it was not until later when i looked at the video afterwards that i could tell i did get something. the lights that i saw were a very bright orange, much more intense than the airplane lights that cross the sky, and definitely a different color.  they were not flashing like the airplane lights do.  you can't see the airplanes that were also in the sky flying in the video, but there were at least two to three airplanes in the area but were at a much higher altitude.  the airplane lights were much dimmer than the orange lights that show up on my video camera footage, and i guess that is why you can't see them in the video... the 3 orange lights i saw were in formation, and not moving in distance from one another, but seemed to be moving as a whole.  they were in a triangle formation, but i could not make out anything in-between the lights like it was some sort of a craft or something.  it was just dark.  the size was enormous, at least 2-3 football fields or more... it is hard to tell size, but it was huge.  much much bigger than the house.  probably easily as big as the entire high school that is directly across the street.  it was moving slowly in the direction of the house and was literally almost right above the patio area where i was filming, although high up in the sky.  there were also two more orange lights, same color and intensity.  one was in front of the triangle, and one behind, as if one was leading the triangle shape, and one was following? or they could have even been possibly connected. it is hard to say.  i could not make out any type of object in-between the lights, just the actual formation itself. it got so close that i ran inside the house to shut off the light, and when i came back out, it was gone.  i looked all around the sky outside the house, and could not see it anywhere.  if it was an object, it either disappeared completely, or turned off the lights or left at an immense rate of speed, because i was only in the house for about 10-20 seconds before i came back outside again to continue filming.  it just disappeared.  i never thought i would actually see something like this.  i only get to see it on tv...  i was completely dazed, and almost shocked when i looked up and saw this thing in the sky that i have seen on tv before... i remember them saying "get video!" so i grabbed my cellphone and ran outside, and i still can't believe i actually have witnessed what many others have. i felt i should share this information since it maybe can help us all finally figure out one day what is up there... i have attached two videos.  the first is the actual footage that i was able to get of the triangle shape, and the next is a short video of exactly what i was doing and how i shot the video about 10 minutes after the event had happened...  thank you.
content.summary: Looked up in sky and saw huge triangle shaped formation like you see on ufo hunters
